alert.note: Alert for Bristol Bay (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 24 at 4:40PM AKST until December 25 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AKST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow. Additional snow accumulations of 6 to 10 inches along the northern Bristol Bay coast and 5 to 10 inches along the southern Bristol Bay coast between King Salmon and Pilot Point. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. Visibilities reduced to as low as one half mile from Dillingham north and west and from Pilot Point to King Salmon. * WHERE...Bristol Bay. * WHEN...Until 6 AM AKST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The heaviest snowfall is expected along a line from north and west of Dillingham to the Alaska Peninsula from King Salmon to Pilot Point. Gusty northerly winds will continue to accompany the snowfall and result in lower visibilities. Visibilities will improve as snow ends from east to west on Sunday morning, with low visibilities lingering the longest near Dillingham.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling.
